actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned pursuant to a previous special order. The next meeting is scheduled for 10:00 a.m. on February 7, 2023.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Ivey moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
On approving the Journal Agreed to by voice vote.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 357
actions-list.actionItem: 56 (Roll no. 107).

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 302 — "To direct the Secretary of Energy to establish a program to provide financial assistance to graduate students and postdoctoral researchers pursuing certain courses of study relating to cybersecurity and energy infrastructure, and for other purposes."

The Chair announced the unfinished business was the question on the motion to suspend the rules and pass H.R. 302, as amended and agreeing to the Speaker's Approval of the Journal, if ordered which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of February 6.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for approximately 6:30 p.m. today.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 302.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Lucas moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 302 — "To direct the Secretary of Energy to establish a program to provide financial assistance to graduate students and postdoctoral researchers pursuing certain courses of study relating to cybersecurity and energy infrastructure, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 423.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 423 — "To take certain land located in San Diego County, California, into trust for the benefit of the Pala Band of Mission Indians, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 548.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 548 — "To take certain Federal lands in Tennessee into trust for the benefit of the Eastern Band of Cherokee Indians."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
Mr. Westerman asked unanimous consent that when the House adjourns today, it adjourn to meet at 10:00 a.m. on February 7. Agreed to without objection.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of February 6.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

The House received a message from the Clerk. Under Clause 2(g) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Clerk notified the House of her designation of Ms. Lisa P. Grant, Deputy Clerk; Mr. Kevin F. McCumber, Deputy Clerk; and Ms. Cheryl H. Muller, Director of Personnel, to sign any and all papers and perform all other acts for her under the name of the Clerk of the House for which they would be authorized to do by virtue of the designation, except such as are provided by statute, in case of her temporary absence or disability and that this designation shall remain in effect for the 118th Congress, or until modified by her.

The House received a message from the Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Clerk notified the House that she had received the following message from the Secretary of the Senate on February 2, 2023 at 4:50 p.m.: That the Senate passed S. 223 and agreed to H. Con. Res. 11. Appointments: Senate Trustee to the James Madison Memorial Fellowship foundation; Canada-U.S. Interparliamentary Group conference during the 118th Congress; Board of Regents of the Smithsonian Institution; Board of Trustees of the Harry S. Truman Scholarship Foundation; Congressional-Executive Commission o the People's Republic of China; and Washington's Farewell Address.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Mr. Wilson of SC to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.

The Chair announced that he had examined the Journal of the last day's proceedings and had approved it. Mr. Wilson (SC) demanded that the question be put on agreeing to the Speaker's approval of the Journal and by voice vote, the Chair announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Wilson (SC) objected to the voice vote based upon the absence of a quorum and the Chair postponed further proceedings on the question of agreeing to the Speaker's approval of the Journal until a time to be announced.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of February 6.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for  2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Mariannette Miller-Meeks to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
